intro: Ardisia scandens, commonly known as the climbing ardisia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Myrsinaceae. It is a woody vine that can grow up to several meters in height, characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with a glossy surface. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in axillary inflorescences. Following flowering, it develops bright red, fleshy berries that are attractive to birds. Ardisia scandens is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
